header.title: A PAULINE ART MAGICAL ADVENTURE
header.category: Western Esotericism, Grimoire Magic, Angelic Magic, Practical Occultism

central_thesis: This document chronicles the author's year-long journey in structuring her magical practice by deeply engaging with the Pauline Art (Lemegeton Book 3). It details the practical application of grimoire traditions, including the identification and evocation of Nativity Angels, the alchemical process of creating astrologically-aligned metal talismans, and the integration of diverse esoteric studies (astrology, metallurgy, art) into a cohesive and personally transformative magical system. The core assertion is that direct, hands-on experience, combined with rigorous study, deepens magical skill and knowledge beyond theoretical understanding.

structure_content.summary: The author initiates a year-long project to structure her magic using the Pauline Art, Book 3 of the Lemegeton, inspired by Aaron Leitch, focusing on practical application and detailed preparation.

This section details the identification of the Nativity Angel (initially Nohiel, later clarified as Sanael for the 3rd degree of Pisces ascendant), the process of initial contact through paper talismans and evocations, the reception of angelic sigils, and the transformative creative work involved in building a Table of Practice and Planetary Images, fostering a strong relationship with the angel.

A comprehensive review of supplementary esoteric texts crucial for understanding the Pauline Art, including Trithemius' Steganographia, Paracelsus' Archidoxes of Magic, The Magical Calendar, Scott Cunningham's works on plants and oils, Iamblichus' writings on ancient mysteries, William Lilly's Christian Astrology, and Agrippa's Three Books of Occult Philosophy. These studies provided context and practical correspondences.

structure_content.chapter_title: Part 3: The Making of My Nativity Talisman
structure_content.summary: The author describes the intricate and challenging process of creating a metal talisman, including resolving discrepancies in historical metal weights (gold, iron, copper, silver, tin), conducting extensive metallurgy experiments for proper melting and alloying, and applying electional astrology to determine the most auspicious times for the metalwork and subsequent engraving of the talisman.

An in-depth account of the final evocation ritual for Sanael, detailing the elaborate preparations (altar setup, ritual bath with specific oil mixes, prayers), the live ritual experience (scrying, pendulum communication, felt angelic presence, specific requests), and a reflection on the findings and unexpected elemental manifestations encountered during the working.

The author concludes by summarizing the profound personal and magical growth experienced throughout the year-long project. She emphasizes the value of practical experimentation, adaptability, and the integration of diverse occult disciplines, noting that direct experience surpasses theoretical knowledge in deepening magical skills and understanding.

key_concepts.definition: A specific grimoire system, detailed in Book 3 of the Lemegeton (Lesser Key of Solomon), focused on working with angels assigned to specific degrees of the zodiac, particularly for natal ascendant degrees.

An angelic entity governing the specific degree of an individual's ascendant at birth, sought for guidance and assistance. The author initially identified Nohiel (2nd degree Pisces) and later, through further astrological consultation, clarified her Nativity Angel as Sanael (3rd degree Pisces) for the main evocation and talisman work, reflecting an evolution in understanding.

A magically consecrated object, often made from an alloy of specific planetary metals, engraved with angelic names, planetary, and zodiacal symbols. Its creation is timed according to precise astrological elections to embed specific influences.

The ritual act of calling forth and communicating with spiritual entities (angels in this context) for the purpose of receiving information, guidance, or assistance, often involving specific preparations, prayers, and tools like scrying stones or pendulums.

A branch of astrology used to determine the most propitious time (election) for starting an undertaking, such as creating a talisman or performing a magical ritual, based on the dignities, aspects, and house placements of celestial bodies relevant to the operation's intent.

A consecrated ceremonial surface, often decorated with planetary sigils and symbols, serving as a focal point and working area for grimoire-style magical operations and evocations, intended to amplify and structure magical energy.

The practical application of melting, alloying, and working with metals, chosen for their planetary correspondences, as a core component of creating durable and potent talismans, requiring specific techniques and safety considerations due to high melting points.

A unique symbolic emblem or glyph received from or attributed to a specific spiritual entity, used as a focal point for contact and communication. The author describes receiving distinct sigils from Nohiel and Sanael.

practical_system.description: The core system described is a modern application of the Pauline Art, specifically for working with Nativity Angels. It systematically integrates astrological election, elemental correspondences, metallurgy, and artistic expression into a structured magical practice. The process begins with identifying the Nativity Angel, progresses through crafting a paper talisman, a year of preparatory work and study, and culminates in the creation of a permanent metal talisman using precise astrological timing and advanced metallurgical techniques, followed by a formal evocation. The system emphasizes direct communication with angelic entities and personal adaptation of grimoire instructions.
tools: Pauline Art grimoires and related esoteric texts (Agrippa, Paracelsus, Trithemius, Lilly).
Raw planetary metals: gold, iron, copper, silver, tin, in precise, calculated weights.
Metallurgy equipment: MAPP gas torch, oxy-acetylene torch, porcelain/steel/clay melting containers, welsch plug molds, plaster of paris, pliers, bench grinder.
Blue paper and blue ink (for temporary talismans and requests).
Various candles (blue, pink, rainbow pyramid, tealight) corresponding to planetary energies.
Oil burner and an array of essential oils (clove, eucalyptus, gardenia, jasmine, lemon, nutmeg, sage, sandalwood, star anise) and infused oils for ritual baths and anointing.
Scrying stones (Rainbow Fluorite, clear quartz cluster) and a black water bowl.
Gold ring on a blue string (for pendulum divination).
Tarot cards for supplementary divination and communication.
Consecrated altar and the self-made 'Table of Practice'.
Blue cloth and pouch for talisman storage.
Personal notes/journal for recording experiences and observations.
rituals: Astrological calculation to identify Nativity Angel based on ascendant degree.
Initial evocation of Nativity Angel (e.g., Nohiel) using a paper talisman, specific planetary hours, and prepared offerings/requests.
Creation and consecration of a 'Table of Practice' incorporating planetary sigils and symbols.
Extensive metallurgical experiments to melt and alloy specific planetary metals (gold, iron, copper, silver, tin) according to alchemical recipes and Pauline Art instructions.
Application of electional astrology to determine auspicious timing for melting metals and engraving the talisman.
Engraving the metal talisman with the Nativity Angel's name (Hebrew), planetary, and zodiac symbols.
Final evocation of the Nativity Angel (e.g., Sanael) with the completed metal talisman, involving ritual baths, anointing, specific prayers, scrying, pendulum communication, and offerings.

relevant_quotes.text: This is a Summary of My Pauline Arts Experience presented in 4 parts: (1) Introduction
The system I choose was the Pauline Art, Book 3 of the Lemegeton or Lesser Key of Solomon
My first step was to find the angel of the ascendant at the time of my birth
"Make this seal when the (Sun) enters (Pisces), of (Sun, Mars, Venus) & (Moon), of each 2 Drams, of (Jupiter) 1 scruple & let it be melted to engrave the same hour the (Sun) enters (Pisces)."
Nohiel expressed a hard to miss fondness for basil very early on in the piece so I dried out a big bunch for him

On completion of my PISCES talisman, no election needed, I am to open the sealed paper talisman/request/collection of metals/nutmeg, barley, almonds from last year. Then melt the metals and engrave with Nohiel's name in hebrew lamed/aleph/yod/ayin/nun on one side, the symbol of Pisces and Jupiter on the other
During my year working with Nohiel I noticed a distinct boost in creativity and focus.
Balancing ALL the elements without bias is the key to this.

The Seal of Pisces should be made in February, when the Sun enters Pisces, of the following metals. [...] Let them be all melted together, and the Seal formed and engraven the same hour of the Suns ingress;

Sanael, Angel of the 3rd degree of Pisces, being the degree on the Ascendant at the moment of my birth into this world, please Guide me on my Path through life towards my Place and Purpose. Help me to realise and maintain Peace and Harmony within Myself and in Tune with Life. Grant me the Wisdom to Guide and Raise my Child in Love.
I feel like what I have achieved and learnt this year will have far reaching effects on the direction my magic takes in the future.

critical_analysis.relevance: This work offers a rare and valuable first-person account of engaging with the Pauline Art grimoire tradition, moving beyond theoretical discussion to detail the practical, alchemical, and astrological challenges inherent in its implementation. It highlights the iterative and adaptive nature of grimoire magic, emphasizing how personal experience and intuition guide the interpretation and execution of ancient texts. The extensive notes on metallurgy, astrological election, and the subjective experience of angelic contact provide significant insight for both academic study and practical application within Western Esotericism.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary audience includes advanced practitioners of grimoire magic, especially those interested in the Pauline Art or angel magic, as well as students of Western Esotericism seeking detailed case studies of magical practice. Individuals interested in the practicalities of talismanic magic, incorporating metallurgy and electional astrology, would also find this document highly informative. The personal, reflective tone also makes it accessible to those exploring the integration of spiritual and practical disciplines for personal growth.
